snippet: A lesson in tough love from American military mentors is proving costly in lives and limbs as Afghan troops seek to demonstrate their self-reliance by the planned NATO withdrawal in 2014.
abstract: Afghan forces, in test to see if they can become self-sufficient by planned 2014 NATO withdrawal, must operate in Afghanistan this summer without American air support, medical evacuation helicopters or partnered combat units; experiment is proving costly for Afghan troops, many of whom have been killed and wounded at record pace.

byline.contributor: Sharifullah Sahak contributed reporting from Kabul, and Taimoor Shah from Kandahar, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: A lesson in tough love from American military mentors is proving costly in lives and limbs as Afghan troops seek to demonstrate their self-reliance by the planned NATO withdrawal in 2014.
